meanings.definition: Make a loud, unpleasant, and prolonged sound.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm noys loudly outside my window.
meanings.sent2: The construction work noys the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The noisy cat noys the peaceful afternoon with its constant meowing.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock noys me awake every morning.
meanings.sent5: The firecrackers noys the silence of the night sky.

meanings.definition: A loud, unpleasant, and prolonged sound.
meanings.sent1: The noys of the traffic outside was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The noys of the barking dog echoed through the park.
meanings.sent3: The noys of the children playing happily filled the air.
meanings.sent4: The noys of the sirens in the distance signaled trouble.
meanings.sent5: The noys of the wind howling through the trees was eerie.

meanings.definition: Cause to be in a state of great disturbance or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints noys her friends.
meanings.sent2: The noisy neighbors noys the entire apartment complex.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy noys the older dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet noys me to no end.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito noys me as I try to sleep.
